incidents.name: Anypoint Monitoring Charts Errors

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue where customers are not able to view Anypoint Monitoring charts.

incidents.name: Runtime Manager Scheduler not showing in UI

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved, if you are still experiencing the impact described please see the previous post on steps to take to resolve the situation for your application.

We have identified the issue that was causing newly deployed applications with schedulers are not deploying the schedulers in the Schedules page of the applications. Any applications deployed between 8:09 AM Pacific time and 7:32 PM Pacific time may still be experiencing this issue.  Any new applications deployed after 7:32PM Pacific time are functioning fine.  We are moving this incident to monitoring.

If you have an application that is not displaying the schedulers in the Schedules UI page when you expect it to, you can take the following steps to correct that situation:

* you have to publish a new version of your asset to exchange
* then redeploy your application using the new version of the asset

Optionally, If the applications are deployed directly from the Runtime Manager UI without assets published manually then you can upload the same JAR file in the applications settings page.

Customers may experience issues with new deployments of a mule application that contains Schedulers to a Cloudhub 2.0 Private Space from the Runtime Manager UI after deployment they may not be able to manage the schedules through the Anypoint Runtime Manager UI.  We are continuing to work on identifying the cause of this issue.
Customers may experience issues where the scheduler does not show in the Runtime UI. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Retroactive Post: Object Store Stats unavailable

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an issue from 2024-03-22 01:25 Pacific to 2024-03-22 01:51 Pacific, where requests were not received by one of our services.

This affected Object Store Stats resulting in 5XX errors when customers tried to access that feature. Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. The site docs.mulesoft.com is intermittently impacted and may be accessible at this time.
Customers may experience the error "no healthy upstream" while using docs.mulesoft.com. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution. Runtimes are not impacted.

incidents.name: Anypoint Platform experiencing some errors

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

Customers will experience 401 coming from Access Management, API Manager might return 401 while getting open ID policies, Runtime Fabric customers might experience issues while downloading Docker images.
Some customers may be experiencing timeouts with certain API policies. Engineering teams are actively investigating the issue

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with usage reports.

incident_updates.body: As of 2:33 PM PT the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
Customers may experience issues while viewing usage report data. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Anypoint Partner Manager Transmission Status not Visible in UI

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved outbound transmissions are now appearing as expected in the Partner Manager UI.

Inbound acknowledgements for outbound transmissions with multiple messages fail to reconcile against corresponding outbound transmission. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is currently being implemented.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We have discovered an issue where customers may not be able to see that status of outbound transmission with multiple messages from the Partner Manager activity UI. Transmissions are functioning as expected however the UI is not displaying the status. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is being implemented.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Composer users may intermittently see an error in the UI when performing a subset of operations like listing of flows and pulling Flow details. Flows already running are not impacted.

incidents.name: Issue Creating Private Spaces

incident_updates.body: As of 14:23 (PT) the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
This issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigating this issue. We have learned that impact is limited to customers creating new private spaces specifically within the us-east-2 region.
We are currently investigating an issue where Private Space customers are not able to create private networks from Runtime Manager UI.

incidents.name: API Manager is failing to apply new policies to applications.

incident_updates.body:
As of 04:07 Pacific, the impact to API Manager is resolved. API Gateway is now able to retrieve and apply all the configured policies. 

API Gateway might continue to show errors for the application of previous versions of the policy but this has no impact on the gateway and the errors will disappear with a restart.
After the actions taken by our technical teams, we are seeing a steady decrease in the error rate and expect to be fully out of impact within the next hour.
We have validated a fix for this incident in our lower environments and are working to deploy it now.  Once deployed and we see the error rates dropping, we will update to monitoring.

This is a retroactive note at 7:27 PM Pacific time, we noted an inaccuracy in our original posting where we explained that existing applications without policy updates would continue to operate normally.  This turned out to be incorrect.  A status post was made at that time on our EU Status site, but it was not communicated here on the US Status site.  Please refer to the previous message for remediation steps while we work to resolve the overall situation.

We have addressed the backend issue causing the errors that have generated this incident, while we work on restoring the service fully, we have identified a remediation step that can be taken to restore your applications to their expected performance.

If your Mule Gateway is currently affected, proceed to restart your Mule Runtime.

If you are unsure if your gateway is currently affected, you can review the logs to see if there is any occurrence of an error message like:

Error deploying policy <POLICY_NAME> to application <APPLICATION_NAME>
com.mulesoft.mule.runtime.gw.policies.template.exception.PolicyTemplateAssetException: Unexpected error when requesting template metadata for <POLICY_NAME>

If you see occurrences of the above error message then you should proceed to restart your Mule Runtime.

Existing applications with the policies will continue to operate smoothly. However, in the event of application restarts or when deploying new apps, there is a risk that they may encounter difficulties in downloading and applying API Manager policies, resulting in deployment failures.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Customers may experience errors while using applying new policies to existing and new applications. Our teams are investigating.

Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

incidents.name: New Templates Unable to be Deployed to Partner Manager

incident_updates.body:
The recent issues affecting Partner Manager customers on CloudHub have been successfully resolved. Our teams have addressed the problems that were causing failures in the deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades. We also resolved the difficulties impacting transaction replays.

Please note that runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows were not impacted during this issue.

We appreciate your patience and understanding while we worked to fix these issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using CloudHub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix. This issue also impacts the ability to replay transactions. Runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows are not impacted due to this issue.
Deploying new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using Cloudhub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix.

incidents.name: Issue creating new Server Groups or Server Clusters

incident_updates.body: As of 04:11 Pacific Time the issue has been resolved and Server Groups and Server Clusters can be created normally. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

Customers will experience issues creating new Server Groups or Server Clusters while using Runtime Manager. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution. Currently running Runtimes, Server Groups or Server Clusters are functioning normally.
We are investigating an issue in Anypoint Runtime Manager. Customers may not be able to create new Server Groups or Server Clusters.

incidents.name: Activation Failure for New Composer Flows

incident_updates.body: As of 02:06 PT the issue has been resolved and all Composer flows are activating normally. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

We have identified the root cause of the issue where new Composer Flows are not activating properly. We are now working diligently to resolve this problem. We appreciate your continued patience and understanding as we work towards a fix.

We are currently experiencing an issue where new Composer Flows are not activating as expected. Users attempting to activate a new flow are finding that instead of the flow transitioning to an active status, it reverts back to edit mode. Our team is aware of this problem and is actively working to diagnose and resolve it. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience while we work on a fix.

incidents.name: Customers [may/will] experience problems with CloudHub 2.0 management of Private Spaces

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The fix is being deployed now across all environments, we will update the site as soon as the rollout is complete.

Customers who have inherited permissions will find that they are not working as expected. If you have a user who is unable to see CloudHub 2.0 private spaces and their configurations because of inherited permissions, an organization administrator can assign the permission directly to the user.

The permissions impacted are:
* Organization Administrator
* CloudHub Network Viewer
* CloudHub Network Administrator

The engineering team is working on rolling back the change that has impacted inherited permissions.

incidents.name: Customers will experience problems with our MuleSoft Anypoint Platform

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [The Anypoint Platform services were unavailable for the EU and US regions - September 20, 2023](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/The-Anypoint-Platform-services-were-unavailable-for-the-EU-and-US-regions-September-20-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

components.name: API Governance
components.description: Ensure APIs conform to governance standards while enabling speed to market.  Anypoint API Governance ensures consistent API quality and security with self-service tools.

components.name: Anypoint Partner Manager v2
components.description: Anypoint Partner Manager v2 accelerates customer adoption of B2B integrations by enabling easy configuration and management of their B2B flows

incidents.name: Customers will experience problems with Mule Runtime

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customers may have experienced issues while upgrading to the new Mule Runtime patch - August 9th 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customers-may-have-experienced-issues-while-upgrading-to-the-new-Mule-Runtime-patch-August-9th-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

Customers will experience issues while using Mule August Patch 3.9.5. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution. While issue is being addressed please do not use the upgrade to the August Patch 3.9.5.
Customers will experience issues while using the Mule August Patch 3.9.5 on Cloudhub. Our teams are investigating.
